sen.j: 例えば、浪花組（後の浪花講）では、主要街道筋の真面目な優良旅籠を指定し、加盟宿には目印の看板をかけさせるとともに、組合に加入している旅人に所定の鑑札を渡して宿泊の際に提示させるようにした。
sen.e: For example, Naniwa-gumi (later Naniwa-ko) designated serious and high-grade hatago along main kaido (road) and had member hatago place a sign as a mark and handed travelers who joined the association over to a given kansatsu (license plate) so that travelers could show it when staying in the inn.

sen.j: また、『浪花組道中記』・『浪花講定宿帳』を発行し、各宿駅ごとに講加盟の旅籠や休所の名を掲載するとともに、道中記としても役立つ道案内を兼ねた情報を掲載した。
sen.e: The association also issued "Naniwa Dochu-ki" and "Naniwa-ko Joyado-cho" in which were listed names of hatago joined in Naniwa-ko and rest houses by shukueki (post town) and included information serving as a guide that was also useful as dochu-ki.
